title: Operations Engineer Job at Nestoil Plc
content:
Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil & gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Engineer

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Job Type: Full-time 

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are on an evolutionary journey where we’re changing our story. We are looking to hire an experienced Operations Engineer to join our diverse team in our Company.
	This role you will be responsible for providing successful management of business operations, while driving the implementation of policies and standards that align with the Business Unit’s vision and business philosophy. 


Responsibilities
As an Operations Engineer, you will be responsible for:


	Working with the MD to develop and align company business objectives with the vision and long-term strategies of the Group. 
	Communicating the Group’s vision and business strategy (short, medium and long terms) and ensure that the company operates in line with the Group’s governance policies, standards and values 
	Working with the MD to develop and implement the company’s business strategies, growth plans an budget in support of the Group’s long term business direction 
	Supporting the MD to put adequate operational systems and controls in place to ensure proper monitoring of the company’s performance against plans and budgets.
	Ensuring proper adherence to the Group’s Quality, Health and Safety policies across all functional units 
	Supporting the MD to facilitate resolution of high priority issues between departments and acts as one of the organization’s ambassadors and spokespersons in matters involving external stakeholders 
	Supporting the MD to ensure that company operations and performance culture comply with approved financial, business and risk management objectives as well as applicable legal and regulatory requirements 
	Supporting the MD in monitoring members of the Business Unit leadership team to effectively deliver on respective functional programmes, achieve set targets and improve overall performance 
	Working with the MD to prepare relevant reports to the Board of Directors on the company’s performance target achievements (i.e financial results, market performance, organizational development plans and overall business performance)  


Requirements
What are we looking for?


	Any good First Degree especially in Engineering, Business Administration, Finance, Social and Behavioural Sciences 
	Post-graduate business degree (including MBA) will be an advantage.
	IWCF (Well Control Certificate)
	Minimum of 8 years post qualification work experience, 3 of which must have been at a management level in an Engineering, Procurement, Construction and maintenance business environment.
	Previous Experience as Operations Engineer with a drilling contractor.
	Highly ethical, self-motivated, diligent and enthusiastic with a winning mentality
	Strong ability to cope well with pressure, solve complex operational problems and deliver within tight timeframes
	Excellent analytical, business development and strategic planning skills 
	Strong negotiation and management skills 
	Excellent networking and people/relationship management ability, as well as interpersonal, project and change management skills 
	Strong communication and presentation skills  
	Highly innovative and adaptable

title: Assistant Manager Job at FlexFilms Limited
content:
FlexFilms Limited is the global film manufacturing arm of India’s largest multinational flexible packaging solutions company, Uflex Limited. With State-of-the-Art film manufacturing facilities in all the 5 major continents Asia, Europe, North America, CIS and Africa our cumulative production capacity stands in excess of 4,52,600 MT Per Annum.

title: Accountant (Financial Reporting) Job at Petrogap Oil and Gas Limited
content:
Petrogap Oil and Gas Limited was incorporated as a response to the emerging trends in the dynamic Oil & Gas industry. We are a wholly indigenous company and registered player in the Upstream, Midstream and Downstream sectors of the Oil & Gas industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant (Financial Reporting)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Preparing High-level financial reports and analysis
	Developing financial strategy and forecasting
	Performs statistical, cost and financial analysis of financial reports and data, and prepares subsequent narrative analysis for management.
	Preparing income statements, balance sheet, profit and loss statement, and other reports,monthly closings and preparation of monthly financial statements.
	Compiles and analyses financial information to prepare entries to account books, such asgeneral ledger accounts and prepare journal entries.
	Compute and remit taxes, tax returns and other tax related reports.
	Consolidateand Manage the Organizations budget
	Cash flow management and Debt management
	Working closely with Management or Executive teams to share reports and analysis findings
	Review expense vouchers, invoices, purchase requisitions or other transactions.
	Handle financial audit with external auditors
	Payroll administration and preparation of monthly sales reports for analysis.
	And other financial reporting functions.


Requiements


	2:1 grade B.Sc. (Minimum qualification) in a relevant discipline and Professional Certification (ICAN etc) is a major requirement
	3 - 5 years of professional experience in financial Reporting.
	Age: 27 - 34 years.
	Sex: Female (for gender balance).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers.pgog@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
